title: Argumentative Essay Rubric

levels.name: Excellent
levels.description: Clear, arguable thesis that directly addresses the prompt and provides a roadmap for the essay.

levels.name: Good
levels.description: Clear thesis that addresses the prompt, though it may lack some specificity or roadmap elements.

levels.name: Fair
levels.description: Thesis is present but unclear, weak, or only partially addresses the prompt.

levels.name: Poor
levels.description: Thesis is missing, unclear, or does not address the prompt at all.

levels.name: Excellent
levels.description: Strong, relevant evidence from credible sources that directly supports the argument. Evidence is well-integrated and properly cited.

levels.name: Good
levels.description: Good evidence that supports the argument, though some sources may be less credible or evidence may be less well-integrated.

levels.name: Fair
levels.description: Some evidence provided, but it may be weak, irrelevant, or poorly integrated into the argument.

levels.name: Poor
levels.description: Little to no evidence provided, or evidence is irrelevant, weak, or improperly used.

levels.name: Excellent
levels.description: Sophisticated analysis that clearly explains how evidence supports the argument. Shows deep understanding and critical thinking.

levels.name: Good
levels.description: Good analysis that explains the connection between evidence and argument, though it may lack some depth.

levels.name: Fair
levels.description: Basic analysis present, but it may be superficial or fail to fully explain the connection between evidence and argument.

levels.name: Poor
levels.description: Little to no analysis provided, or analysis is illogical, superficial, or fails to connect evidence to argument.

levels.name: Excellent
levels.description: Clear, logical organization with smooth transitions between paragraphs. Essay flows naturally from introduction to conclusion.

levels.name: Good
levels.description: Generally well-organized with mostly clear transitions, though some areas may be less smooth.

levels.name: Fair
levels.description: Basic organization present, but transitions may be weak or the structure may be somewhat unclear.

levels.name: Poor
levels.description: Poor organization with weak or missing transitions, or structure that is confusing or illogical.

levels.name: Excellent
levels.description: Clear, precise language with varied sentence structure. Tone is appropriate and engaging. Few to no grammatical errors.

levels.name: Good
levels.description: Generally clear language with some sentence variety. Tone is mostly appropriate. Minor grammatical errors that don't impede understanding.

levels.name: Fair
levels.description: Language is mostly clear but may be repetitive or simplistic. Some grammatical errors that occasionally impede understanding.

levels.name: Poor
levels.description: Language is unclear, repetitive, or inappropriate. Frequent grammatical errors that significantly impede understanding.

scaleNote: This rubric uses a 4-point scale where 4 = Excellent, 3 = Good, 2 = Fair, 1 = Poor. Total possible points: 20. Letter grades: A+ (18-20), A (16-17), B+ (14-15), B (12-13), C+ (10-11), C (8-9), D (6-7), F (0-5).
